marketNews.title: Ketua The Fed, Jerome Powell, akan menyampaikan pidato di Jackson Hole, Wyoming pada Jumat (22/8) waktu setempat.
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Fed, Jerome Powell, will deliver a speech in Jackson Hole, Wyoming on Friday (8/22) local time. Reuters reported that market participants will watch whether Powell in his speech signals a cut in US interest rates in the upcoming September 2025 meeting. In recent months, Powell has repeatedly made hawkish comments amid uncertainty due to President Donald Trump's tariffs, but weak US employment data for the period of July 2025 has increased market expectations for the chance of a US rate cut in September 2025.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia mencatat bahwa neraca berjalan (current account) Indonesia pada 2Q25 defisit 3 miliar dolar AS atau setara 0,8% terhadap PDB (vs. 1Q25: defisit 0,1% terhadap PDB), sejalan dengan pola musiman seiring pembayaran dividen dan kupon oleh perusahaan.
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia's current account in 2Q25 had a deficit of 3 billion US dollars or equivalent to 0.8% of GDP (vs. 1Q25: 0.1% deficit of GDP), in line with seasonal patterns as a result of dividend and coupon payments by companies. Bank Indonesia itself maintains the projection that the current account deficit throughout 2025 will range between 0.5-1.3% of GDP. Meanwhile, the balance of payments in 2Q25 recorded a deficit of 6.7 billion US dollars (vs. 1Q25: 800 million US dollar deficit), due to the outflow of foreign capital in the form of domestic bonds.

marketNews.title: Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi dilaporkan telah menangkap Wakil Menteri Ketenagakerjaan, Immanuel Ebenezer, terkait dugaan pemerasan pengurusan sertifikasi Keselamatan dan Kesehatan Kerja (K3) sebuah perusahaan.
marketNews.content: The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) was reported to have arrested the Deputy Minister of Manpower, Immanuel Ebenezer, regarding the alleged extortion of Occupational Safety and Health (K3) certification processing for a company.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg melaporkan bahwa PT Freeport Indonesia berencana untuk mengekspor ~350.000 ton konsentrat tembaga sebelum izin ekspornya berakhir pada pertengahan September 2025, sebuah langkah yang dapat meringankan industri smelter tembaga di luar negeri di tengah penyusutan margin akibat kelebihan kapasitas produksi dan pengetatan pasokan bahan baku.
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that PT Freeport Indonesia plans to export approximately 350,000 tons of copper concentrate before its export permit expires in mid-September 2025, a move that could ease the overseas copper smelter industry amid shrinking margins due to production overcapacity and tightening raw material supply. This export plan will result in PT Freeport Indonesia utilizing 90% of the copper concentrate export quota permitted by the Indonesian government since March 2025, up from the level of 65% as of mid-August 2025. After September 16, 2025, PT Freeport Indonesia will no longer be able to export copper concentrate without additional permits from the government.

tickerNews.title: PACK: Rights Issue for Nickel Mining Share Acquisition
tickerNews.content: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama (PACK) plans to hold a rights issue in the form of the issuance of convertible bonds (OWK), which can later be converted into up to 35 billion new shares, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 95.58%. PT Eco Energi Perkasa as the controlling shareholder of the company will act as a standby buyer to guarantee the purchase of the remaining shares and/or other equity-type securities not exercised by the company's shareholders. The proceeds from this rights issue will be used to acquire 30% of PT Konutara Sejati shares and 34.5% of PT Karyatama Konawe Utara shares from a non-affiliated company, Denway Development Limited, for a total value of 2.7 trillion rupiah. PT Konutara Sejati and PT Karyatama Konawe Utara operate in the nickel mining sector. Details regarding the nominal value, schedule, or exercise price of the OWK have not yet been announced. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on September 25, 2025.

tickerNews.title: DSSA: MSCI announces 0.5 adjustment factor application in August 2025 index review concerning free float uncertainty.
tickerNews.content: DSSA: MSCI announced it will apply an adjustment factor of 0.5 to Dian Swastatika Sentosa's Foreign Inclusion Factor (FIF) in the August 2025 index review. MSCI explained that this decision was made after receiving input from market participants regarding uncertainty about DSSA's free float and considering its significant proforma weight in the MSCI Indonesia Index. This MSCI decision will cause DSSA's FIF, currently at 0.25 (25%), to be revised to 0.13 (13%). This announcement still confirms that DSSA will be included in the MSCI index, but this adjustment may cause a downweighting in the initial calculation of DSSA in MSCI and potentially lead to a reduction in fund flow of around 50% from the initial estimate.

tickerNews.title: BRMS clarifies that it has no current plan to build its own refining facility as processing fees are affordable, while seeking financing for capital expenditure.
tickerNews.content: BRMS: Bumi Resources Minerals stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company currently has no plans to build its own refining facility because the processing fee is still affordable, although the company does not rule out assessing the construction of a refining facility in the future. BRMS also explained that the company and its subsidiaries are in the process of obtaining financing facilities from several banks for capital expenditure and working capital related to the development of the company's assets. BRMS's clarification came after Investor Daily reported that the company was assessing a plan to build a gold refining facility and would receive a loan facility worth 500 million US dollars at the end of August or early September 2025 from banks affiliated with the Salim group.

tickerNews.title: ADHI booked new contract value of IDR 3.8 trillion as of July 2025, equivalent to 13.6-15.2% of the 2025 target.
tickerNews.content: ADHI: Adhi Karya's Corporate Secretary, Rozi Sparta, stated that the company recorded a new contract value of 3.8 trillion rupiah during 7M25 (-68% YoY), equivalent to 13.6-15.2% of the 2025 target in the range of 25-28 trillion rupiah. Based on its projects, ADHI's new contracts during 7M25 came from building projects (42%), infrastructure (26%), engineering and industry (16%), and the remainder from other projects.

tickerNews.title: BSDE plans to issue bonds and sukuk worth up to IDR 500 billion each, with 88% allocated for BSD City infrastructure development.
tickerNews.content: BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai plans to issue bonds and sukuk with a principal value of up to 500 billion rupiah each, where 88% of the proceeds are allocated for the development of BSD City infrastructure in Tangerang and the remainder for working capital. These bonds and sukuk, which have received idAA and idAAsy ratings from Pefindo respectively, will be issued in 3 series with tenors of 3, 5, and 7 years, but the interest rate/yield has not been announced. The public offering is scheduled for September 17-18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: SMGR cement sales volume down -10% YoY in July 2025, resulting in 7M25 volume down -3.6% YoY.
tickerNews.content: SMGR: Semen Indonesia recorded a cement sales volume of -10% YoY in July 2025, although it increased by +12% MoM due to seasonality effects in the second half. This result caused SMGR's sales volume for 7M25 to decrease by -3.6% YoY (vs. 7M24: -2% YoY), pressured by weakening domestic cement sales volume of -7.4% YoY amidst strengthening non-domestic sales volume (including exports) of +12% YoY. Meanwhile, market share decreased annually to 48.3% in July 2025 (vs. July 2024: 49.3%, June 2025: 47.3%) and 47.7% during 7M25 (vs. 7M24: 49.9%, 1H25: 47.6%). By segment, domestic bag and bulk cement sales volumes decreased by -4.5% YoY and -14% YoY, respectively, throughout 7M25.

tickerNews.title: NSSS Director buys shares, increasing stake.
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera (NSSS), Teguh Patriawan, purchased approximately 29.6 million NSSS shares at an average price of 370 rupiah per share on August 19, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 10.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Teguh Patriawan's share ownership portion in NSSS increased from 11.29% to 11.41%.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Director sells shares, decreasing direct ownership percentage.
tickerNews.content: The Director of TBS Energi Utama (TOBA), Sudharmono Saragih, sold 300,000 TOBA shares at an average price of 1,097 rupiah per share on August 13, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 329.1 million rupiah. After this transaction, Sudharmono Saragih's direct ownership portion in TOBA decreased from 0.01198% to 0.00834%.
